decks.notes: The main concept of this Aggro-Affinity deck is to quickly deploy a board full of artifact creatures and use cards like Cranial Plating and Steel Overseer to pump them up and turn them into powerful attackers. With efficient mana sources like Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum, alongside cheap artifact creatures like Ornithopter and Signal Pest, this deck aims to swarm the board and overwhelm the opponent with a combination of evasive creatures and direct damage spells like Galvanic Blast. The inclusion of key cards like Arcbound Ravager and Etched Champion further solidify its aggressive game plan.

This deck is focused on filling up the graveyard quickly with cards like Faithless Looting and Life from the Loam, allowing you to trigger Dredge abilities and bring back key creatures like Prized Amalgam and Narcomoeba. By leveraging cards like Conflagrate and Collective Brutality, you can control the board while steadily building up a powerful board presence. The lands in the deck provide a good balance of colored mana sources to support your strategy. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to utilize the Dredge mechanic to efficiently and effectively fill up your graveyard and overwhelm your opponent with recursive threats.

This Abzan Aggro deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures and disruptive spells. By utilizing powerful cards like Tarmogoyf, Grim Flayer, and Lingering Souls, the deck can apply pressure early in the game and maintain momentum throughout. Supporting cards like Liliana of the Veil and Thoughtseize help disrupt the opponent's game plan, while cards like Path to Exile and Abrupt Decay deal with threats efficiently. The deck's mana base is carefully constructed to ensure consistent access to all three colors while also providing utility lands like Shambling Vent for additional value.

The main concept of this deck is to control the opponent's draws and prevent them from playing their key cards by using Lantern of Insight to see the top card of their library and cards like Codex Shredder and Ghoulcaller's Bell to manipulate those draws. Ensnaring Bridge helps protect the player from creatures attacking, while Pithing Needle shuts down key activated abilities. The deck also has a variety of disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Abrupt Decay to further control the game. The goal is to lock down the game and outvalue the opponent through card manipulation.

Utilizing graveyard synergy and recursion, this deck aims to quickly fill the graveyard with key creatures like Bloodghast, Narcomoeba, and Prized Amalgam, while dredging Golgari Grave-Troll and Stinkweed Imp to fuel the engine. The goal is to bring back creatures repeatedly, triggering powerful abilities and overwhelming the opponent with an aggressive board presence. Using cards like Faithless Looting and Life from the Loam to set up combos and Conflagrate as a finisher, the deck can quickly close out games with explosive turns and relentless pressure.

This Jund Aggro deck focuses on aggressive gameplay with efficient creature threats like Tarmogoyf, Grim Flayer, and Scavenging Ooze, backed up by disruptive cards like Thoughtseize, Inquisition of Kozilek, and Liliana of the Veil. Removal spells such as Lightning Bolt and Terminate help control the board while also dealing damage to the opponent. The deck also includes some versatile removal options like Abrupt Decay and Kolaghan's Command. The land base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and include utility lands like Raging Ravine for additional threats.

This deck focuses on aggressively attacking the opponent with efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Scavenging Ooze while disrupting their game plan with hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek. Additionally, it utilizes powerful removal spells like Terminate and Lightning Bolt to control the board and clear a path for its creatures to deal damage. The deck also features versatile cards like Kolaghan's Command and Abrupt Decay to provide flexibility in different matchups. Overall, this deck aims to apply early pressure, disrupt the opponent's strategy, and close out the game quickly.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through early hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, while also having removal spells like Maelstrom Pulse and Abrupt Decay to deal with threats on the board. The use of counterspells like Cryptic Command and Mana Leak helps to control the pace of the game. The deck also has a strong creature package with Tarmogoyf, Snapcaster Mage, and delve creatures like Tasigur, the Golden Fang and Gurmag Angler. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and provide utility with lands like Creeping Tar Pit.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly assemble the combo pieces necessary to win the game using the Ad Nauseam spell. By combining cards like Angel's Grace and Phyrexian Unlife to prevent losing the game from life loss, the deck aims to draw the entire deck with Ad Nauseam, finish the game with Laboratory Maniac, or create a lethal Lightning Storm. The deck also utilizes cards like Pact of Negation and Spoils of the Vault to protect the combo and search for key pieces.

The deck focuses on swarm tactics with low-cost artifact creatures and fast mana acceleration. It aims to quickly flood the board with creatures and pump them up with equipment like Cranial Plating to deal massive damage. The key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggression and synergy between artifact creatures and support cards. The deck's strength lies in its speed and ability to consistently put pressure on the opponent before they can establish their own game plan.

The main concept of the Naya Zoo deck is to aggressively play low-cost, efficient creatures like Kird Ape, Wild Nacatl, and Tarmogoyf to quickly deal damage to the opponent. The deck also utilizes burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Atarka's Command to control the board and remove threats. Devastating Summons can be used to create a large board presence quickly, while Reckless Bushwhacker provides a strong finisher. The land base is optimized to support the aggressive strategy, with a mix of fetch lands and shock lands for consistent mana fixing.

The main concept of this Modern 1 vs 1 Aggro - Death's Shadow deck is to utilize aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear, Street Wraith, Wild Nacatl, and Death's Shadow, along with powerful pump spells like Become Immense and Temur Battle Rage, to quickly reduce the opponent's life total to zero. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Gitaxian Probe to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The mana base is designed to support the deck's aggressive strategy while also providing flexibility in casting the various spells in the deck.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping into powerful Eldrazi creatures to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of speed and disruption. It utilizes mana acceleration from cards like Noble Hierarch and Birds of Paradise to cast big threats like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer ahead of schedule. Eldrazi Displacer adds versatility by providing both a strong attacker and the ability to disrupt the opponent's board. The deck also includes interaction in the form of Path to Exile and Spellskite to handle threats from the opponent.

The deck focuses on being aggressive and disruptive, using cards like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's hand while efficiently applying pressure with strong creatures like Tarmogoyf and Dark Confidant. The deck also utilizes powerful removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Terminate to control the board. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Blood Moon and Liliana of the Veil adds another layer of disruption to the opponent's game plan. The deck's mana base is carefully constructed to support its aggressive strategy while maintaining consistency and flexibility.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by countering and removing opponent's threats while drawing card advantage and stabilizing with powerful finishers like Ajani Vengeant and Celestial Colonnade. The deck utilizes a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw to outvalue the opponent and control the pace of the game. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the spells needed for control while also providing flexibility in terms of available colors of mana.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana and search for Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle along with Mountains to deal massive amounts of damage to the opponent by sacrificing lands with Scapeshift or triggering Valakut with Primeval Titan. The deck also includes various ways to find and play additional lands to ensure the player can consistently hit their land drops and activate Valakut's ability multiple times in a single turn, overwhelming the opponent with a burst of damage.
